nodes.documentation:
@title Organization manager contract
@notice This contract holds implementation logic for all org management
functionality. This can be called only by the implementation
contract only. there are few view functions exposed as public and
can be called directly. these are invoked by quorum for populating
permissions data in cache
@dev the status of the organization is denoted by a set of integer
values. These are as below:
0 - Not in list,
1 - Org proposed for approval by network admins
2 - Org in Approved status
3 - Org proposed for suspension and pending approval by network admins
4 - Org in Suspended,
Once the node is blacklisted no further activity on the node is
possible.
nodes.name: OrgManager

contract

devdoc.details: the status of the organization is denoted by a set of integer values. These are as below: 0 - Not in list, 1 - Org proposed for approval by network admins 2 - Org in Approved status 3 - Org proposed for suspension and pending approval by network admins 4 - Org in Suspended, Once the node is blacklisted no further activity on the node is possible.

addOrg(string).details: org will be added if it does exist

params._orgId: unique org id to be added

addSubOrg(string,string).details: org will be added if it does exist

params._pOrgId: unique org id to be added

params._orgId: unique org id to be added

approveOrgStatusUpdate(string,uint256).details: status cannot be updated for sub orgs. This function can be called for the following actions: 1 - to suspend an org 2 - to activate the org back

params._orgId: unique org id to be added

getOrgDetails(string).return: org idparent org idultimate parent idlevel in the org treestatus

getOrgInfo(uint256).return: org idparent org idultimate parent idlevel in the org treestatus

updateOrg(string,uint256).details: status cannot be updated for sub orgs. This function can be called for the following actions: 1 - to suspend an org 2 - to activate the org back

params._orgId: unique org id to be added

devdoc.title: Organization manager contract

addOrg(string).notice: function for adding a new master org to the network

addSubOrg(string,string).notice: function for adding a new sub org under a parent org

approveOrg(string).notice: function to approve org status change for master orgs

approveOrgStatusUpdate(string,uint256).notice: function to approve org status change for master orgs

checkOrgActive(string).notice: confirms that org status either active or pending suspension

checkOrgExists(string).notice: confirms if the org exists in the network

checkOrgStatus(string,uint256).notice: confirms that org status is same as passed status

methods.constructor: constructor. sets the permissions upgradable address

getNumberOfOrgs().notice: returns the total number of orgs in the network

getOrgDetails(string).notice: returns org info for a given org id

getOrgInfo(uint256).notice: returns org info for a given org index

getSubOrgIndexes(string).notice: returns the array of sub org indexes for the given org

getUltimateParent(string).notice: returns the master org id for the given org or sub org

setUpOrg(string,uint256,uint256).notice: called at the time of network initialization. sets the depth breadth for sub orgs creation. and creates the default network admin org as per config file

updateOrg(string,uint256).notice: updates the status of a master org.

userdoc.notice: This contract holds implementation logic for all org management functionality. This can be called only by the implementation contract only. there are few view functions exposed as public and can be called directly. these are invoked by quorum for populating permissions data in cache
